pullRequest.body:
Add two theorems solving goals of this form: for any primes `p` and `q` such that `p != q`, `padicValNat p (p^n * q^m) = n`


---

I do wonder how often we'll have both `[Fact p.Prime]` and `[Fact q.Prime]` available but in any case there is nothing controversial here.

Thanks!

bors d+
LGTM (see my suggestion below)

I do wonder how often we'll have both `[Fact p.Prime]` and `[Fact q.Prime]` available but in any case there is nothing controversial here.

Thanks!

bors d+

```suggestion
  rw [padicValNat.mul (NeZero.ne' (p^n)).symm (NeZero.ne' (q^m)).symm, padicValNat.prime_pow, 
    padicValNat.pow _ <| Nat.Prime.ne_zero hq.elim, padicValNat_primes neq, mul_zero, add_zero]
```
If you want, you could golf away the `have` like this

Or better yet, you could factor this out as a lemma

```
theorem padicValNat_prime_prime_pow {q : ℕ} [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime]
    (n : ℕ) (neq : p ≠ q) : padicValNat p (q ^ n) = 0 := by
  rw [padicValNat.pow _ <| Nat.Prime.ne_zero hq.elim, padicValNat_primes neq, mul_zero]

theorem padicValNat_prod_pow_left {q : ℕ} [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime]
    (n m : ℕ) (neq : p ≠ q) : padicValNat p (p^n * q^m) = n := by
  rw [padicValNat.mul (NeZero.ne' (p^n)).symm (NeZero.ne' (q^m)).symm,
    padicValNat.prime_pow, padicValNat_prime_prime_pow m neq, add_zero]
```

and then both lemmas would be golfed, as well as another potentially useful lemma added.
Thank you for your help, I guess the second version is better! I commit your changes

We use `prod` for an indexed product of a family and `mul` for the binary product
```suggestion
theorem padicValNat_mul_pow_left {q : ℕ} [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime]
```

```suggestion
theorem padicValNat_mul_pow_right {q : ℕ} [hp : Fact p.Prime] [hq : Fact q.Prime]
```
I'd be tempted to prove this use `mul_comm` and the lemma above but what you have is fine too.
Indeed, that's a better idea. I updated the proof accordingly.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/Padics/PadicVal): Add `padicValNat_mul_pow_left/right`
